author: James Martin
programme: Operation Hospital Food with James Martin
method: Heat the olive oil and the butter in a large saucepan, add the onion, cover and fry gently for 3-4 minutes. Add the cauliflower and continue to cook for a further 2-3 minutes. Add the remaining ingredients and bring to the boil, reduce to a simmer and cook for five minutes, or until the cauliflower is tender. Put the soup in a blender and pulse until smooth.  Season to taste with salt and freshly ground black pepper then serve.
ingredients: 2 tbsp olive oil,  50g/1¾oz butter,  200g/7oz onion, thinly sliced,  700g/1lb 9oz cauliflower, very thinly sliced,  2 Cox’s apples, cored, peeled and diced,  2 vegetable stock cubes,  750ml/1¼ pint milk,  750ml/1¼ pint water,  salt and freshly ground black pepper
